questions.title: What is the difference between <div> and <span> elements?
questions.option_1: <div> is an inline element, while <span> is a block-level element.
questions.option_2: <div> is a block-level element, while <span> is an inline element.
questions.option_3: <div> cannot contain other elements, while <span> can.
questions.correct_answer: <div> is a block-level element, while <span> is an inline element.

questions.title: Which CSS property is used to set the opacity of an element?
What does the 'position: sticky' property do in CSS?
questions.option_1: It allows an element to scroll with the page until a certain point.
questions.option_2: It keeps the element fixed in its original position regardless of scrolling.
questions.option_3: It makes the element invisible when scrolling.
questions.option_4: It applies a sticky effect to the element only on mobile devices.
questions.correct_answer: It allows an element to scroll with the page until a certain point.

questions.option_4: Defines the width of flex items.
questions.correct_answer: Defines how much a flex item can grow relative to the rest.

questions.title: Which CSS property can be used to create a responsive image?

questions.option_1: To store custom data private to the page or application.

questions.option_4: To specify the version of HTML used.
questions.correct_answer: To store custom data private to the page or application.

questions.title: What is the result of using the 'display: none' property on an HTML element?
questions.option_1: The element will still occupy space in the layout.
questions.option_2: The element will be hidden and not occupy space in the layout.
questions.option_3: The element will be visible but with zero opacity.
questions.option_4: The element will be partially visible.
questions.correct_answer: The element will be hidden and not occupy space in the layout.

questions.title: Which CSS property is used to create rounded corners on an element?

questions.option_1: Embed a video in the webpage.
questions.option_3: Draw graphics on the fly using JavaScript.
questions.correct_answer: Draw graphics on the fly using JavaScript.

questions.title: What is the purpose of the <source> element in HTML5?
questions.option_1: To specify alternate video or audio files.
questions.option_3: To link to an external JavaScript file.
questions.correct_answer: To specify alternate video or audio files.

questions.title: Which property is used to change the text color in CSS?
What does the 'visibility' property do in CSS?
questions.option_1: Hides the element but still occupies space.
questions.option_2: Completely removes the element from the layout.
questions.option_4: Changes the display type of the element.
questions.correct_answer: Hides the element but still occupies space.

questions.title: What is the difference between 'margin' and 'padding' in CSS?
questions.option_1: 'Margin' creates space inside an element, while 'padding' creates space outside.
questions.option_2: 'Margin' creates space outside an element, while 'padding' creates space inside.
questions.option_3: They are the same and can be used interchangeably.
questions.option_4: 'Margin' is for vertical spacing, while 'padding' is for horizontal spacing.
questions.correct_answer: 'Margin' creates space outside an element, while 'padding' creates space inside.
